contentrichtext.text: {{references|date=May 2012}} {{Infobox Given Name Revised |name=Kaylee |image= |imagesize= |caption= |pronunciation= {{IPAc-en|ˈ|k|eɪ|l|i}} {{respell|KAY|lee}} |gender= [[Female]] |meaning= ''slender'' |region= |origin= [[Irish Gaelic language|Irish Gaelic]] |related names= Cailey, Caleigh, Caylee, Cayley, Kailee, Kaileigh, Kailey, Kaleigh, Kaley, Kaylea, Kayleigh, Kayley, Kayli, Kaylie, Kaili, Katherine, Kayla, Ke'lyn, Kailie, Kaelee |footnotes= }} '''Kaylee''' (also commonly spelt ''Kayley'' and ''Kayleigh'') is a [[female]] [[given name]] formed through the combination of the names [[Kay]] and [[Lee (given name)|Lee]]. Kay is an [[English language|English]] short form of the name [[Katherine]], while Lee means "pasture" in English.{{Citation needed|date=October 2008}} Alternately, it is sometimes considered as an Anglicized version of the [[Irish Gaelic language|Irish Gaelic]] [[céilidh]], a type of social dance or party in Ireland and Scotland. ==See also== *[[Céilidh]], a Celtic country dance with similar pronunciation *[[Kayleigh]], a 1985 song by British [[neo-progressive rock|neo-prog rock]] band [[Marillion]] which popularised the name *[[Kayla (name)|Kayla]], Kylie, similar female given names with different etymologies. *[[Kaylynn]] *[[Kaylee DeFer]] (b. 1986), American actress *[[Kaylee Frye]], a character from the television series ''Firefly'' (2002–2003) and the movie ''Serenity'' (2005) <!-- It does not help to add disambig or hndis tags where the page only contains people who share a given name --> [[Category:English feminine given names]]
